intro: Koanophyllon wetmorei, commonly known as the wetmore's leafy shrub, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, narrow leaves. The plant produces daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is adapted to harsh, dry environments and has a deep root system to access water. Koanophyllon wetmorei is often found in rocky soils and is an important component of desert ecosystems.
